column7: You have received a briefing note produced by a Generative Artificial Intelligence (GenAI) model. The note was written for a hypothetical Senior Canadian public service leader with the rank of Dep...
column8: What briefing note are you evaluating? Select by Note ID (please match the ID at the top of the document you received)
column9: Communication: The note clearly states its intended purpose
column10: Purpose: The opening statement unambiguously conveys the note’s intent
column11: Variety: Diverse sentence structures and types enhance readability
column12: Conciseness: Short sentences and paragraphs maintain brevity
column13: Readability: The note is easy to read, comprehend, and remember
column14: Brevity: The length adheres to the document's standards, avoiding redundancy
column15: Clarity: The note ensures clear understanding without ambiguity upon first reading
column16: Tone: The tone is appropriate for the briefing note, its recipients and the person signing it.
column17: Language: Grammar, punctuation, spelling, typography, and syntax have been meticulously reviewed
column18: Global Content: Essential information is neutrally conveyed
column19: Global Content: The note is self sufficient
column20: Global Content: The content demonstrates thorough research
column21: Global Content: The content is consistent with the announced objectives.
column22: Global Content: Sound decision can be made based on the note’s content
